member.name: T:Json.Schema.BuildContext
member.summary: Provides contextual information required during the construction of a schema, including build options, schema documents, and dialect settings.
member.remarks: Use this structure to pass relevant build parameters processing keywords. The context encapsulates both global and local schema data, as well as the base URI and dialect, ensuring consistent schema resolution and validation throughout the build process.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.BuildContext.Options
member.summary: Gets the configuration options used for the build process.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.BuildContext.BaseUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the base URI used to resolve relative resource references.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.BuildContext.LocalSchema
member.summary: Gets or sets the local value from which a new schema is to be built.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.BuildContext.Dialect
member.summary: Gets or set the JSON Schema dialect to use in the build process.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.BuildContext.RelativePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the in addition to the keyword.
member.remarks: For example, for the `properties` keyword, this pointer indicates the property name.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.BuildContext.From(Json.Schema.KeywordData)
member.summary: Creates a copy of a build context from the one that was used to build a keyword.
member.param: The keyword.
member.returns: A copy of the build context.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.BuildOptions
member.summary: Provides configuration options for schema building, including registries and dialect selection.
member.remarks: Use this class to customize how schemas are built, such as specifying registries for schemas, vocabularies, and dialects. The options set in this class determine how schema resolution and dialect selection are performed during the build process. The static property provides a set of default options suitable for most scenarios.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.BuildOptions.Default
member.summary: The default settings.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.BuildOptions.SchemaRegistry
member.summary: The local schema registry. If a schema is not found here, it will automatically check the global registry as well.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.BuildOptions.VocabularyRegistry
member.summary: The local vocabulary registry. If a vocabulary is not found here, it will automatically check the global registry as well.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.BuildOptions.DialectRegistry
member.summary: The local dialect registry. If a dialect is not found here, it will automatically check the global registry as well.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.BuildOptions.Dialect
member.summary: Gets the dialect to be used when building schemas with these options.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Dialect
member.summary: Represents a JSON Schema dialect, defining the set of supported keywords and validation rules for a specific schema version.
member.remarks: A dialect encapsulates the behavior and interpretation of JSON Schema keywords according to a particular specification draft. Use a specific dialect instance, such as , to validate or process schemas that conform to that draft. Dialects may differ in supported keywords, validation semantics, and handling of unknown keywords. This class is typically used to select the appropriate schema version when working with JSON Schema documents.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Dialect.Draft06
member.summary: Gets the JSON Schema dialect definition for Draft 6.
member.remarks: Use this property to evaluate schemas that conform to the JSON Schema Draft 6 specification. The dialect includes all standard Draft 6 keywords and allows unknown keywords. Sibling keywords are ignored when resolving references using the '$ref' keyword.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Dialect.Draft07
member.summary: Gets the JSON Schema dialect definition for Draft 7.
member.remarks: Use this property to evaluate schemas that conform to the Draft 7 specification. The dialect includes all standard Draft 7 keywords and allows unknown keywords. Sibling keywords are ignored when resolving references using the "$ref" keyword.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Dialect.Draft201909
member.summary: Gets the JSON Schema dialect definition for Draft 2019-09.
member.remarks: Use this property to evaluate schemas that conform to the Draft 2019-09 specification. The dialect includes all standard Draft 2019-09 keywords and allows unknown keywords. Sibling keywords are processed when resolving references using the "$ref" keyword.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Dialect.Draft202012
member.summary: Gets the JSON Schema dialect definition for Draft 2020-12.
member.remarks: Use this property to evaluate schemas that conform to the Draft 2020-12 specification. The dialect includes all standard Draft 2020-12 keywords and allows unknown keywords. Sibling keywords are processed when resolving references using the "$ref" keyword.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Dialect.Default
member.summary: Gets or sets the default JSON Schema dialect for new objects.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Dialect.RefIgnoresSiblingKeywords
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether references ignore sibling keywords during processing.
member.remarks: Set this property to to ensure that references do not consider keywords defined by sibling elements. This can affect how references are resolved in scenarios where sibling keywords may otherwise influence behavior.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Dialect.AllowUnknownKeywords
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether unknown keywords are permitted during processing.
member.remarks: Set this property to to allow keywords that are not explicitly recognized. This can be useful when working with extensible or user-defined keyword sets.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Dialect.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for the dialect.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Dialect.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Json.Schema.IKeywordHandler})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Dialect class using the specified collection of keyword handlers.
member.remarks: The provided keyword handlers are used to configure the dialect's keyword metadata and dependency evaluation. The constructor will throw an exception if any element in the collection is null.
member.param: A collection of keyword handlers to be included in the dialect. Each handler defines the behavior and metadata for a specific keyword. Cannot be null.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Dialect.V1_2026
member.summary: Gets the JSON Schema dialect definition for v1/2026.
member.remarks: Use this property to evaluate schemas that conform to the v1/2026 specification. The dialect includes all standard v1/2026 keywords and disallows unknown keywords. Sibling keywords are processed when resolving references using the "$ref" keyword.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Dialect.V1
member.summary: Gets the JSON Schema dialect definition for v1. This is the same as the latest yearly release in the v1 version.
member.remarks: Use this property to evaluate schemas that conform to the v1-compatible specifications. The dialect includes all standard v1 keywords and disallows unknown keywords. Sibling keywords are processed when resolving references using the "$ref" keyword.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.DialectExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for creating modified instances of the type by adding or removing keyword handlers.
member.remarks: These methods enable fluent customization of objects without altering the original instance. Use to add keyword handlers and to remove them, optionally overriding dialect properties such as Id, RefIgnoresSiblingKeywords, and AllowUnknownKeywords in the resulting instance.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.DialectExtensions.With(Json.Schema.Dialect,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Json.Schema.IKeywordHandler},System.Uri,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Creates a new Dialect instance by extending the specified dialect with additional keyword handlers and optional configuration overrides.
member.remarks: This method is useful for creating customized dialects based on an existing one, allowing selective addition of keyword handlers and configuration overrides. The original dialect remains unchanged.
member.param: The base Dialect to extend. Cannot be null.
A collection of keyword handlers to add to the new Dialect. Cannot be null.
An optional identifier for the new Dialect. If null, the identifier from the base dialect is used.
An optional value indicating whether '$ref' keywords ignore sibling keywords. If null, the value from the base dialect is used.
An optional value indicating whether unknown keywords are allowed. If null, the value from the base dialect is used.
member.returns: A new Dialect instance containing the combined keyword handlers and configuration settings.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.DialectExtensions.Without(Json.Schema.Dialect,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Json.Schema.IKeywordHandler},System.Uri,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Creates a new Dialect instance by removing the specified keyword handlers from the given dialect.
member.remarks: The returned Dialect retains all configuration options from the source dialect unless overridden by the optional parameters. This method does not modify the original Dialect instance.
member.param: The source Dialect from which keyword handlers will be removed.
A collection of keyword handlers to exclude from the resulting Dialect. Each handler in this collection will be omitted.
An optional identifier to assign to the new Dialect. If null, the identifier from the source dialect is not set.
An optional value indicating whether '$ref' should ignore sibling keywords in the new Dialect. If null, the value from the source dialect is used.
An optional value indicating whether unknown keywords are allowed in the new Dialect. If null, the value from the source dialect is used.
member.returns: A new Dialect instance with the specified keyword handlers removed and updated configuration options as provided.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.DialectRegistry
member.summary: Provides a registry for managing and retrieving JSON Schema dialects by their unique identifiers.
member.remarks: The registry allows registration and unregistration of custom dialects. A global singleton instance is available via the property for application-wide access. Getting dialects via local instances fall back to the global registry.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.DialectRegistry.Global
member.summary: Gets the global registry of JSON Schema dialects used throughout the application.
member.remarks: Use this property to access or configure JSON Schema dialects that should be available application-wide. Changes to the global registry affect all components that rely on shared dialect definitions.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.DialectRegistry.Register(Json.Schema.Dialect)
member.summary: Registers a custom dialect for use in the system.
member.remarks: Registering a dialect allows it to be used in subsequent operations. Official dialects cannot be overwritten or replaced.
member.param: The dialect to register. The dialect must have a non-null identifier and must not conflict with any official dialects.
member.exception: Thrown if has a null Id, or if the dialect's identifier matches an official dialect.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.DialectRegistry.Unregister(System.Uri)
member.summary: Unregisters a dialect identified by the specified URI, removing it from the collection of available dialects.
member.param: The URI that uniquely identifies the dialect to unregister. Cannot be an official dialect.
member.exception: Thrown if refers to an official dialect, which cannot be removed.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.DotnetCompatibility
member.summary: Provides compatibility extension methods that replicate .NET API behaviors on earlier framework versions.
member.remarks: This class contains static extension methods that offer functionality introduced in later .NET versions, enabling codebases to use newer APIs when targeting older frameworks. Methods are conditionally included based on the target framework version and are intended to ease cross-version development and migration.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.ErrorMessages
member.summary: Manages error messages returned by built-in keywords.
member.remarks:
Default messages are provided by culture-specific resource files.
Many messages support tokens in the format `[[foo]]`. Each message will specify the tokens it supports.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ErrorMessages.Culture
member.summary: Gets or sets a culture to use for error messages. Default is .

member.name: M:Json.Schema.ErrorMessages.Get(System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a localized error message string for the specified key and culture.
member.remarks: If the parameter begins with "Get", that prefix is removed before looking up the resource. This method is typically used within error-handling code to retrieve user-facing error messages based on the calling member.
member.param: The culture to use when retrieving the error message. If null, the default culture or the current thread's culture is used.
The resource key identifying the error message to retrieve. If not specified, the caller's member name is used.
member.returns: A localized error message string corresponding to the specified key and culture.
member.exception: Thrown if an error message resource with the specified key cannot be found.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.EvaluationContext
member.summary: Provides contextual information used during schema evaluation, including options, scope, instance data, and evaluation paths.
member.remarks: The EvaluationContext struct encapsulates all relevant data required for evaluating a JSON schema against an instance. It includes evaluation options, dynamic scope for reference resolution, pointers to the current evaluation and instance locations, and access to the schema registry. When building custom keywords that use subschemas, create a new context by copying this one and modifying the , , and/or properties as appropriate.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.EvaluationContext.Options
member.summary: Gets the evaluation options.
member.remarks: This may be different per run, so it's important this not be captured by constraints.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.EvaluationContext.Scope
member.summary: Gets the dynamic scope.
member.remarks: The dynamic scope is the collection of URIs that evaluation has passed through to get to the current location. This is important when processing references.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.EvaluationContext.InstanceRoot
member.summary: Gets the JSON element that represents the instance data root.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.EvaluationContext.Instance
member.summary: Gets the JSON element that represents the instance data.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.EvaluationContext.EvaluationPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a JSON Pointer representing the path through the schemas and across references to the currently evaluated subschema.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.EvaluationContext.InstanceLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the JSON Pointer indicating the location of the instance within the JSON document.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.EvaluationContext.SchemaRegistry
member.summary: Gets the schema registry used to manage and retrieve schema resources.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.EvaluationContext.RefIgnoresSiblingKeywords
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether reference resolution ignores sibling keywords during processing.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.EvaluationContext.EvaluatedKeywords
member.summary: Gets the collection of keyword evaluations that have been performed for the current instance.
member.remarks: This property is set internally and may be null if no keyword evaluations have occurred. The returned list reflects the latest evaluation results and is updated after each evaluation process. Keywords are guaranteed to be processed in the correct sequence if the attribute is used properly.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.EvaluationContext.CanOptimize
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current configuration allows optimization.

member.summary: Specifies whether the `format` keyword should be required to provide validation results. Default is false, which just produces annotations for drafts 2019-09 and prior or follows the behavior set forth by the format-annotation vocabulary requirement in the `$vocabulary` keyword in a meta-schema declaring draft 2020-12.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.FormatRegistry
member.summary: Represents a thread-safe registry for managing and retrieving format definitions within the application.
member.remarks: Use the FormatRegistry to register, unregister, and look up format definitions by key. The static Global property provides access to a shared, application-wide registry pre-populated with common formats. This class is designed for scenarios where centralized management of formats is required, and is safe for use across multiple threads.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.FormatRegistry.Global
member.summary: Gets the global registry of formats available throughout the application.
member.remarks: Use this property to access a shared, application-wide instance of the format registry. The global registry is intended for scenarios where a centralized format store is required. This property is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.FormatRegistry.Register(Json.Schema.Format)
member.summary: Registers the specified format for later retrieval by its key.
member.param: The format to register. The format's key must be unique within the collection.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.FormatRegistry.Unregister(System.String)
member.summary: Unregisters the format associated with the specified name, removing it from the collection if it exists.
member.remarks: If no format is registered with the specified name, this method has no effect. This method is thread-safe.
member.param: The name of the format to unregister. Cannot be null.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.FormatRegistry.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the format associated with the specified key, searching local and global collections.
member.remarks: If the format is not found in the local collection, the method searches the global collection before returning an unknown format. The returned format is never null.
member.param: The key that identifies the format to retrieve. Cannot be null.
member.returns: The format associated with the specified key if found; otherwise, a format representing an unknown key.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.IBaseDocument
member.summary: Represents an identifiable base document that may be or may contain a JSON Schema.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.IBaseDocument.BaseUri
member.summary: Gets the base URI that applies to this schema. This may be defined by a parent schema.
member.remarks:
This property is initialized to a generated random value that matches `https://json-everything.net/{random}` where `random` is 10 hex characters.
It may change after the initial evaluation based on whether the schema contains an `$id` keyword or is a child of another schema.

Build context.
member.returns: A JSON Schema, if found.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.IKeywordHandler
member.summary: Defines the contract for handling custom JSON Schema keywords, including validation, subschema construction, and evaluation logic.
member.remarks: Implementations of this interface enable extensibility for JSON Schema processing by supporting custom keyword behaviors. Each handler is responsible for validating keyword values, building any required subschemas, and evaluating the keyword during schema validation. This interface is intended for advanced scenarios where custom schema keywords are needed.

member.returns: An object that is shared with the other methods. This object is saved to .

member.summary: Builds and registers subschemas based on the specified keyword data within the provided build context.

The context in which subschemas are constructed and registered. Cannot be null.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.JsonMath
member.summary: Provides static methods for performing mathematical operations and comparisons on JSON numeric values represented by instances.
member.remarks: The methods in this class are designed to work directly with the textual representation of JSON numbers, enabling precise comparison and divisibility checks without converting to .NET numeric types. This is useful for scenarios where exact JSON number semantics are required, such as schema validation or custom JSON processing. All methods are thread-safe and do not modify the input instances.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.JsonMath.NumberCompare(System.Text.Json.JsonElement,System.Text.Json.JsonElement)
member.summary: Compares two JSON number values represented by instances and determines their relative order.
member.remarks: This method performs a numeric comparison based on the JSON number representations, handling differences in sign, digit sequence, and exponent. Both parameters must represent valid JSON numbers; otherwise, the result is undefined.
member.param: The first containing a JSON number to compare.
The second containing a JSON number to compare.
member.returns: A signed integer that indicates the relative order of the numbers: less than zero if is less than ; zero if they are equal; greater than zero if is greater than .

member.name: M:Json.Schema.JsonMath.Divides(System.Text.Json.JsonElement,System.Text.Json.JsonElement)
member.summary: Determines whether the numeric value represented by the specified JSON element is evenly divisible by the value of another JSON element.
member.remarks: Both parameters must represent valid JSON numbers. If the divisor is zero or not a valid number, the method returns false. If the dividend is zero, the method returns true.
member.param: The JSON element representing the dividend. Must contain a valid numeric value.
The JSON element representing the divisor. Must contain a valid numeric value.
member.returns: true if the dividend is evenly divisible by the divisor; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.JsonSchema.Build(System.Text.Json.JsonElement,Json.Schema.BuildOptions,System.Uri)
member.summary: Builds a JsonSchema instance from the specified JSON schema root element, applying the provided build options and base URI if specified.
member.remarks: The returned schema is registered with the provided or global schema registry. Reference resolution and cycle detection are performed during the build process. The base URI is set on the resulting schema and used for reference resolution.
member.param: The root JsonElement representing the JSON schema to be parsed and built. Must be a valid JSON schema object.
Optional build options that control schema parsing behavior, such as registry usage and dialect settings. If null, default options are used.
An optional base URI to associate with the schema for resolving references if the schema does not contain an $id keyword. If null, a default base URI is generated.
member.returns: A JsonSchema instance representing the parsed schema. Returns a singleton schema for boolean schemas ( or ), or a constructed schema for object-based definitions.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.JsonSchema.BuildNode(Json.Schema.BuildContext)
member.summary: Builds a new JSON schema node from the specified build context, interpreting the local schema and its keywords according to the active dialect.
member.remarks:
This method processes schema keywords and handles dialect-specific behaviors, such as anchor registration and embedded resource management. The resulting node reflects the schema's structure and metadata as defined in the context.
Use this method from keywords to build subschemas.
Individual keywords may throw various exceptions during the validation phase.
member.param: The build context containing the local schema, dialect, base URI, and options used to construct the schema node. Must not be null.
member.returns: A JsonSchemaNode representing the parsed schema, including its keywords and any registered anchors or embedded resources.
member.exception: Thrown if the local schema is not a boolean or an object.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.JsonSchema.Evaluate(System.Text.Json.JsonElement,Json.Schema.EvaluationOptions)
member.summary: Evaluates the specified JSON instance against the schema and returns the results.
member.param: The JSON data to be evaluated against the schema.
(Optional) Evaluation settings that control validation behavior. If null, default options are used.
member.returns: An EvaluationResults object containing the outcome of the schema validation, including any errors or annotations.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.JsonSchema.FindSubschema(Json.Pointer.JsonPointer,Json.Schema.BuildContext)
member.summary: Finds the subschema node within the root schema that corresponds to the specified JSON pointer.
member.param: The JSON pointer indicating the location of the subschema to find within the root schema.
The build context used for schema evaluation and node construction if the subschema is not found directly.
member.returns: A representing the subschema at the specified pointer, or if no matching subschema exists.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.JsonSchema.op_Implicit(System.Boolean)~Json.Schema.JsonSchema
member.summary: Implicitly converts a boolean value into one of the boolean schemas.
member.param: The boolean value.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.JsonSchemaJsonConverter
member.summary: Provides custom serialization and deserialization logic for objects when using System.Text.Json.
member.remarks: Use this converter to enable reading and writing of instances with System.Text.Json. This converter handles the mapping between JSON schema representations and objects, ensuring correct parsing and formatting during serialization operations.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.JsonSchemaJsonConverter.Read(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader@,System.Type,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Deserializes a JSON value from the specified reader into a instance.
member.param: The positioned at the JSON value to read. The reader must be at the start of a valid JSON schema object.
The type to convert the JSON value to. This parameter is ignored; the method always returns a .
The serializer options to use when reading the JSON value. Must not be .
member.returns: A instance representing the deserialized schema, or if the JSON value is not a valid schema.
member.exception: Thrown when the JSON value cannot be deserialized into a valid . See the inner exception for details.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.JsonSchemaJsonConverter.Write(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter,Json.Schema.JsonSchema,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Writes the specified JSON schema to the provided writer using the given serializer options.
member.param: The writer to which the JSON schema will be written. Must not be null.
The JSON schema to write. Must not be null.
The serializer options to use when writing the JSON schema. Must not be null.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.JsonSchemaBuilder
member.summary: A fluent-style builder for .

member.name: P:Json.Schema.JsonSchemaBuilder.Empty
member.summary: Gets an instance of that represents an empty JSON schema.
member.remarks: Use this property to obtain a schema with no defined constraints or properties. This can be useful as a starting point for building more complex schemas or when a schema is required but no validation is needed.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.JsonSchemaBuilder.True
member.summary: Gets a schema builder that creates a schema which always validates as .
member.remarks: Use this property to obtain a schema that unconditionally accepts any JSON value. This is equivalent to a schema defined as true in JSON Schema specifications.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.JsonSchemaBuilder.False
member.summary: Gets a schema builder that always evaluates to false, representing a schema that does not match any JSON value.
member.remarks: Use this property to create a schema that explicitly rejects all input. This can be useful for disabling or invalidating parts of a schema in compositional scenarios.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.JsonSchemaBuilder.#ctor(Json.Schema.BuildOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the JsonSchemaBuilder class.
member.remarks: Use this constructor to create a new JsonSchemaBuilder for defining and constructing JSON schema objects. The builder can be configured with various schema properties and constraints before generating the final schema.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.JsonSchemaNode
member.summary: Represents a subschema.
member.remarks: A JsonSchemaNode provides the context and data necessary for evaluating a subschema against an instance. It supports evaluation of schema logic, including handling of boolean schemas and keyword-based validation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the base URI used for resolving relative paths or requests.
member.remarks: The base URI should be an absolute URI.

member.summary: Gets the original JSON source data this subschema.
member.remarks: Use this property to access the raw JSON content for inspection or further processing.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.JsonSchemaNode.Keywords
member.summary: Gets the collection of keyword data this subschema.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.JsonSchemaNode.RelativePath
member.summary: Gets a JSON Pointer to this subschema from the parent subschema, excluding the intermediate keyword.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.JsonSchemaNode.Evaluate(Json.Schema.EvaluationContext)
member.summary: Evaluates the schema against the provided context and returns the results of the evaluation.
member.remarks: If the schema is a boolean schema, the evaluation result is determined immediately. For schemas with keywords, each keyword is evaluated in order, and the overall validity is determined by their contributions. The method manages evaluation scope and tracks evaluated keywords, errors, and annotations as appropriate.
member.param: The evaluation context containing the instance data, schema location, and evaluation options to use during schema evaluation. Cannot be null.
member.returns: An EvaluationResults object containing the outcome of the schema evaluation, including validity, errors, annotations, and details. The results reflect the evaluation of all applicable keywords in the schema.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.KeywordData
member.summary: Represents the data and metadata associated with a JSON Schema keyword, including its handler, raw value, evaluated value, and any associated subschemas.
member.remarks: Instances of this class are used during JSON Schema processing to track keyword-specific information. The properties provide access to both the raw JSON representation and the processed value, as well as any subschemas relevant to the keyword.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.KeywordData.Handler
member.summary: Gets the keyword handler used to process keyword-related operations.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.KeywordData.RawValue
member.summary: Gets the underlying JSON value represented by this instance.
member.remarks: This property provides direct access to the raw JSON data as a . It can be used to inspect or process the value without additional parsing or conversion.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.KeywordData.Subschemas
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of subschema nodes.
member.remarks: Each element in the array represents a subschema that is part of the overall schema definition.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.KeywordData.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets a value.
member.remarks: The value may or may not represent the value of the keyword. It is primarily useful for pre-processing values and communicating them between the methods.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.KeywordEvaluation
member.summary: Represents the result of evaluating a keyword, including its validity, associated annotation, and any subschema evaluation results.
member.remarks: Use this struct to capture the outcome of a keyword evaluation, such as in schema validation scenarios. The struct provides information about the keyword, whether it was valid, any related annotation data, subschema results, and error information if applicable. The static Ignore field can be used to represent a keyword evaluation that should be excluded from further processing.

member.name: F:Json.Schema.KeywordEvaluation.Ignore
member.summary: Represents a special evaluation that indicates a keyword should be ignored during processing.
member.remarks: This instance is typically used to mark keywords that are intentionally excluded from validation or further analysis. The generated keyword value is unique for each application run.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.KeywordEvaluation.Keyword
member.summary: Gets the keyword that produced the evaluation.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.KeywordEvaluation.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a validation succeeded.
member.remarks: Some keywords do not produce a validation result. In these cases, this property will default to true.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.KeywordEvaluation.Annotation
member.summary: Gets the a JSON annotation produced by the keyword.
member.remarks: The annotation can contain arbitrary metadata or additional information in JSON format. If no annotation is present, the value is .

member.name: P:Json.Schema.KeywordEvaluation.Details
member.summary: Gets the collection of evaluation results produced by subschemas.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.KeywordEvaluation.Error
member.summary: If validation failed, this may get an error message.
member.remarks: Not all keywords produce an error message when they fail validation.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.KeywordEvaluation.ContributesToValidation

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Keywords.AnchorKeyword.GetAnchorPatternRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^[A-Za-z_][-A-Za-z0-9._]*$
Options:
RegexOptions.Compiled
Explanation:
Match if at the beginning of the string.
Match a character in the set [A-Z_a-z].
Match a character in the set [\-.0-9A-Z_a-z] atomically any number of times.
Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Keywords.Draft06.IdKeyword.GetAnchorPatternRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^[A-Za-z][-A-Za-z0-9.:_]*$
Options:
RegexOptions.Compiled
Explanation:
Match if at the beginning of the string.
Match an ASCII letter.
Match a character in the set [\-.0-:A-Z_a-z] atomically any number of times.
Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Keywords.Draft201909.AnchorKeyword.GetAnchorPatternRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^[A-Za-z][-A-Za-z0-9.:_]*$
Options:
RegexOptions.Compiled
Explanation:
Match if at the beginning of the string.
Match an ASCII letter.
Match a character in the set [\-.0-:A-Z_a-z] atomically any number of times.
Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.SchemaRegistry
member.summary: Provides a registry for storing and retrieving JSON schemas and other base documents by URI and anchor.
member.remarks: The registry supports registering schemas with unique URIs and enables lookup by URI or anchor. Schemas can be fetched automatically using the delegate if not already registered. The property provides a shared, application-wide registry instance. Getting schemas via local instances fall back to the global registry.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Vocabulary
member.summary: Represents a collection of keyword handlers associated with a specific vocabulary identifier.
member.remarks: Only JSON Schema drafts 2019-09 and 2020-12 make use of vocabularies. A vocabulary defines a set of keywords and their corresponding handlers, typically used to interpret or validate structured data according to a particular specification. The vocabulary is identified by a unique URI, and its keywords determine the behaviors or constraints it supports.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.VocabularyRegistry
member.summary: Provides a registry for managing JSON Schema vocabularies, allowing registration and unregistration of custom vocabularies in addition to well-known official vocabularies.
member.remarks: The registry maintains a set of official vocabularies that cannot be modified or removed. Use the property to access a shared, application-wide registry instance. Getting vocabularies via local instances fall back to the global registry.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.VocabularyRegistry.Global
member.summary: Gets the global registry of vocabularies available throughout the application.
member.remarks: Use this property to access a shared, application-wide instance of the vocabulary registry. The global registry is intended for scenarios where a centralized vocabulary store is required. This property is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.VocabularyRegistry.Register(Json.Schema.Vocabulary)
member.summary: Registers a custom vocabulary for use within the system.
member.remarks: Registering a vocabulary allows it to be referenced and used in subsequent operations. Official vocabularies cannot be overwritten or replaced by custom registrations.
member.param: The vocabulary to register. The vocabulary's identifier must not conflict with any official vocabularies.
member.exception: Thrown if the vocabulary's identifier matches an official vocabulary, preventing overwriting of well-known vocabularies.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.VocabularyRegistry.Unregister(System.Uri)
member.summary: Removes the vocabulary identified by the specified URI from the registry.
member.param: The URI that uniquely identifies the vocabulary to remove. Cannot be an official vocabulary.
member.exception: Thrown if refers to an official vocabulary, which cannot be removed.
